title: Quality Specialist Intern
description:
Company Overview

Sleep Number team members are part of a passionate, purpose-driven culture that supports improving the health and wellbeing of society through higher quality sleep. We are not just focused on our customers, however; being employed by Sleep Number means your personal wellbeing is important, too. As we continue to grow, we are looking for team members who will bring their unique... personalities, backgrounds, and skills to work. Whether you are entering, returning, or experienced in the workforce, we have a place for you.

In our 35+ years in the industry we have improved over 14 million lives, and we are just getting started. With 5,000+ team members nationwide supporting work disciplines from technology to manufacturing, retail stores to field services technicians, corporate teams to customer service, we are a sleep innovation leader because of our team members. Now is a great time to join us as we invest further in our people and sleep innovation. #TeamSleepNumber

At Sleep Number we are improving lives every day by helping people sleep better every night. Learn more about a company that’s championing a health and wellness revolution with quality sleep at its core. Join our Quality Team for a 12-week internship experience. Our focus is to advance the supply chain’s data driven decisioning and to provide a unique and beneficial learning experience. Our Plant Quality Engineer Intern will conduct focused project work in support of the development of the Sleep Number quality system vision and framework at a specific site. In this position they will support conducting an internal system assessment, identify current state, and developing the future vision/value proposition to create an integrated quality system. The focus will be on COPQ metrics, quality data analysis, and centralizing the QMS. The Plant Quality Engineer Intern will assist in establishing the quality system framework and support the cross functional development of the proposed solution. In this role the selected candidate will support the iterative-scaled implementation of the quality system across the business. Establish processes to continuously evaluate and improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the quality system.

Primary Responsibilities

Specific projects may include:

Quality system current state assessment
• Support data analysis and metric tracking for COPQ
• Identify the key quality processes of Sleep Number’s Quality Management System
• Assist in identifying a digital quality tool for use across all sites to support Quality Systems.

Quality system vision, value proposition & execution
• Establish a uniform method of measuring COPQ that is efficient and provides a clear focus for problem solving activities.
• Support the development of the quality system vision and framework for execution of Quality Systems across Sleep Number
• Support defining/selecting the digital quality system that integrates customers, suppliers, and business enterprise.
• Use system owners to implement changes within the facilities

Quality system governance & continuous improvement
• Establish and maintain full COPQ with efficient data analysis to provide useful focus for production sites.
• Support implementation of digital quality tools/data governance process to ensure data integrity and ongoing tool improvements for efficient performance.
• Apply project management principals to ensure timely and cost-effective implementation and completion of projects.
• Establish and maintain critical metrics for effectiveness of digital quality system.

Position Requirements
• Currently pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in an engineering discipline or related field.
• Proficient user of Microsoft Office Tools: Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
• Ability to work with leaders on scope of work and outcome. Once established, self-directed to accomplish tasking.
• Analytical mind-set experienced using problem solving techniques.
• Ability to optimally communicate to all levels of the organization
• Willingness to work in a team environment
• Handle multiple activities simultaneously and ensure accurate and timely completion of tasks

Additional Program Details:
• Competitive compensation
• Full intern summer events program
• Campus Ambassador opportunities

Wellbeing

Our company's purpose is to improve the health and wellbeing of society.

Wellbeing is more than a catchphrase - it's a movement that permeates our company and through our team members. We are dedicated to enhancing and supporting the wellbeing of our team members and their families through benefits, programs, and resources across our five wellbeing pillars of emotional, financial, career, community, and physical health, with sleep at the center.

By joining our team, in addition to offering competitive pay programs, we are proud to offer eligible team members an extensive benefits package including, but not limited to medical and pharmacy benefits, dental, life and disability insurance, a matched 401(k) Plan, paid time off, and much more.

Examples of how we invest in your wellbeing:
• Sleep - Our 360® smart bed for team members, and discounts on our innovations and sleep solutions for yourself and friends and family throughout the year.
• Physical - Wide range of wellbeing resources and services through our medical plans to improve your physical health.
• Emotional - Access to mental health resources, caregiving support, paid time off and parental leave to support your emotional wellbeing. Work for your day flexibility, available for select corporate roles.
• Financial - Competitive base and variable pay programs, ability to save for the future through a matched 401(k) plan and financial support to recover from an illness or injury.
• Community - Paid time off for volunteering and connections to our communities through our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion initiatives, and support for charitable causes.
• Career - Opportunities for career development and continuous learning, including a tuition reimbursement program.

Safety

Safety is a top priority for Sleep Number supporting customers and team members wellbeing. COVID-19 Precaution(s) are in place consistent with CDC guidelines, U.S. Department of Labor’s Occupational Health & Safety Administration (OSHA), and state/local laws.

EEO Statement

Sleep Number is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to recruiting, hiring and promoting qualified people and prohibit discrimination based on race, color, marital status, religion, sex (including gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), veteran status, uniformed servicemember status or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.

Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

It is Sleep Number’s policy to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities during the application process, consistent with applicable law. We may require supporting medical or religious documentation where applicable and permissible by law. If you are a qualified individual, you may request a reasonable accommodation at any time during the selection process, including if you are unable or otherwise limited in your ability to access open roles here

title: Family Nutrition Access Intern
description:
**Job Description**
• *Scope of Intern Work**:This position supports our Maternal and Child Health (MCH) Program by helping parents access healthy foods through the Women, Infants and Children (WIC) government benefit program. The process of applying and using WIC benefits is difficult, even for English speakers. The MCH program has enlisted volunteers to help clients learn how to travel to their... WIC clinic and use benefits at the grocery store. The Family Nutrition Access Intern will be responsible for scheduling WIC appointments, overseeing volunteers, and improving the functioning of this program.

The IRC SLC office is partially reopened. Intern should be available to work one day per week in the office as well as remotely. Must be able to work independently and be flexible to a changing work environment.
• *Responsibilities**:

• Schedule WIC appointments and volunteers; Confirm appointments and interpretation

• If available, liaise with volunteers to troubleshoot during appointments

• Track completion of WIC appointments and grocery orientations

• Communicate progress and challenges with supervisor

• Help create, present, distribute, and evaluate educational material

• Additional tasks to assist with MCH Program as needed

• Office duties: Transport a client to a health appointment weekly; Complete Office Support shift monthly
• *Additional Opportunities**:

• Create monthly communications to keep volunteers up to date and engaged

• Document lessons learned

• Recruit and train new volunteers
• *Learning Objectives**:

1\. The intern will expand experience communicating, educating, and working with diverse populations.

2\. The intern will gain management skills, supervising and training WIC volunteers.

3\. The intern will improve professional skills, working as a team member in a cross-cultural environment.
• *Commitment**: 16 weeks starting in May 2022, 10-15 hours per week
• *Qualifications**
• *Requirements**:

• Must be currently enrolled in a graduate/undergraduate program, or have graduated less than 6 months ago

• Background in public health, social work, health promotion OR other related fields

• Experience working with diverse populations

• Self-motivated, flexible, patient and able to work independently

• Detail oriented and creative problem solver

• Strong computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook)

• Must be able to prioritize and manage time effectively

• Must have reliable means of transportation for transporting clients

This is an unpaid internship position. No financial compensation, including compensation for relocation, is available.
• *IRC leading the way from harm to home.**

title: Data Analytics Intern
via: via Jobs At Branch | Branch Careers - Pinpoint
description:
Data Analytics Intern

Department: Data and Business Analytics...

Employment Type: Internship

Location: United States

Compensation: $25.00 / hour
Description

Branch is on a mission to make insurance less expensive, so more people can be covered. We use technology, data, and automation to avoid bait-and-switch quotes and unnecessary costs that can make getting covered a struggle. The result? Prices in seconds. Hundreds in savings passed along to our members.

Our team is venture-backed, natively remote, and growing fast, recently achieving an over $1 Billion valuation. We’re working together to restore insurance to its original purpose - a force for communal good.

Branch's Data & Business Analytics Team

Our Data & Business Analytics team works in the Branch Data Office to manage Branch's data environment and its supporting infrastructure. They unearth data stories and enable leaders to make informed data-driven business decisions that impact Branch's short and long term growth.

The Branch Data Environment

Branch has a unique approach to data and business analytics that makes them differentiated in the market. All data is carefully managed through an ETL tool into a cloud data lake. Branch is in the process of implementing a third party software to provide version control and automated testing support for maintaining SQL scripts that organize and process information within the data lake. The data team then shepherds the organization, documentation, and visualization of the data for end users to utilize. Use cases range from core Accounting / Finance infrastructure, daily KPI reporting in all business units, automation implementation, and core data product feature enablement. Data analysts work with departments to process requests, drive insights for the business, and build out many of the use cases from the data lake through end deliverables. Product managers work adjacent to the architects and analysts to shepherd requests from end users and ensure that the end result of requests are being achieved.

About the Data Analytics Intern role

Our Data Analytics Intern this fall will oversee and improve our data management process and reporting. They will have a first-hand view into the business operations across all functions and will be leading the charge on leveraging Branch’s technology capabilities to give immediate insights into how the company is growing.

This Intern will be instrumental in our advanced analytics capabilities, data input processing, quality assurance, view constitution, data documentation, and data outputs for analysis by decision makers.

Key Responsibilities
• Support Branch Leadership’s understanding of the business with KPI automation and reporting.
• Evaluate data in the data lake for design and accuracy.
• Define and document data views so data can be better understood and used by internal stakeholders.
• Support various departments for building out additional internal and external reporting capabilities.
• Help lead discussions on researching and driving for business answers to business questions using Branch’s advanced data analytics capabilities.
• Ad Hoc reporting support and projects.

Skills Knowledge and Expertise
• Undergrad student majoring in Business, Engineering, or Math discipline with a focus on Analytics, or a Data Analytics major preferred.
• Excels in a fast-paced environment
• Ability to work 10-20 hours per week during the fall semester
• Loves problem solving and can do it efficiently and effectively.
• Has experience in a data analysis or software development environment:
• Knowledge of SQL is highly preferred, but having analyzed data in R or Alteryx, or having done software development is also acceptable.
• Data visualization through Qlik, Looker, Tableau, Excel, or another data visualization platform.
• Visualizes data processes and database construction in order to discern insights.
• Loves interacting with people and can communicate professionally and effectively both in writing and on phone/web meetings with internal and external stakeholders.
• Thrives in a remote environment. Branch is a native-remote company
• Is a team player and as passionate about building this community as we are

title: MBA Leadership Development Program (LDP) Internship- Summer 2023
description:
The world needs solutions, and we need you! At BASF, we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through... science and innovation.

We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety and the safety of our employees and the communities in which we operate. We are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and career development.

We are also constantly striving to become an even better place to work. In 2022, BASF has been recognized as a Top 50 Company for Diversity by DiversityInc for the tenth consecutive year, ranking number 12 on the list. BASF also achieved a perfect 100-point ranking on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation’s Corporate Equality Index (CEI), earning the distinction as a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality. Additionally, BASF was named a Top 50 Employer by Minority Engineer Magazine; a Top Company for Executive Women by Seramount; and has been certified as a Most Loved Workplace® by Most Loved Workplaces, which certifies companies based on independent research and employee feedback. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future!

MBA Leadership Development Program (LDP) Internship- Summer 2023

Where the Chemistry Happens…

BASF's Leadership Development Programs (LDPs) were created to provide highly motivated, mobile-minded current university students an opportunity to enhance their professional skills through a variety of diverse learning experiences. Our MBA LDP internship is a precursor to our rotational program, which combine hands-on experience, both technically and strategically, with unparalleled networking opportunities designed to accelerate your career development at BASF.

Program Summary:

We offer students the opportunity to spend a summer working at one of BASF’s US locations. This program also offers graduate students the ability to apply their education and background to challenging assignments to build general management skills.

· As a highly motivated graduate student, you will participate in a 10 to 12-week internship at one of BASF’s US locations.

·Your ability to mobile will be critical as US locations include, but are not limited to: New Jersey, Michigan, North Carolina, Texas, Louisiana.

· Interns will complete various projects, designed and planned to enhance your career development and deliver immediate value to BASF.

· Projects may include preparing operational plans, market research, break-even analysis, acquisitions, and divestitures.

· Successfully engaging across the business throughout your internship will expand your network, allow you to grow personally and professionally, and learn a variety of valuable skill sets.

· All interns will be assessed throughout the summer for a full time offer for our 2-year rotational program

title: Intern Research Scientist
description:
About Tydo

Tydo helps e-commerce Brands optimize their business. We provide visibility into their unit economics, marketing channels and customer retention, allowing Brands to identify their best customers and measure campaign effectiveness...

At Tydo, you’ll get the benefits of working directly in the consumer product world while also tackling exciting data problems. We see learning and collaboration as the best parts of our day and believe spending 10% of your time making the other 90% of your life easier is a good bet. We are meeting-lite, lean, and hungry. That being said, we drop things as soon as we can to help each other out. We enjoy working with each other and are keen on solving grisly eCommerce and logistics problems.

We are a data-first company; we load it, transform it, and tell stories with it. We’re backed by Founder’s Fund, Greylock Partners, YCombinator and top-tier e-commerce and fintech founders.

About the Role

We are seeking summer or fall internship/co-op candidates who are interested in projects related to time-series forecasting, predictive modeling, recommendation systems, and building generalized models from sparse data. The research outcome will directly impact the core technology we are building. Promising results will be accelerated to product deployment.

Responsibilities:
• Implement generalized machine learning models that can work well with sparse data.
• Implement associative learning through Graph Neural Network that can be combined with a predictive modeling approach for dynamic personalization.
• Challenge state of the art methods for feature extraction from customer transaction data, data from marketing channels combined with the power of NLP that directly impacts building better recommendation systems..
• Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to senior leadership and influence strategic decision-making.

Skills:
• Currently in the process of obtaining a Bachelor’s, Master's, or PhD in a quantitative field (Applied Math, Engineering, Computer Science).
• Strong fundamental knowledge in deep learning and classical machine learning algorithms.
• Coding fluency in Python.
• Experience with data science packages in Python. (Sckit-learn, pandas, pytorch, numpy).
• Loves a fast paced startup environment, thrives in chaos with a can do attitude.

Nice to have:
• Prior experience in time series modeling, recommendation systems and clustering approaches is a plus.
• Research publication track record is a plus

title: Zero Waste Internship
via: via Frontier Co-Op | Careers Center | Welcome - ICIMS
description:
Overview

Do you have a passion Identifying Solutions for Landfill Diversion...

Do you want to work for a company that encourages an entrepreneurial spirit and supports your passion for sustainability and natural products?

If so, then Frontier Co-op is for you. Since 1976, Frontier Co-op has been showing the world that Doing Good, Works.

We are currently seeking an Zero Waste Intern to join our team and support our efforts in diverting 90% of waste from landfill. Now more than 40,000 member-owners strong, we’re dedicated to sourcing and packaging the highest quality spices, herbs and botanical products through our Frontier Co-op, Simply Organic® and Aura Cacia® brands. We’re driven by a simple purpose: to do good by our people and planet. And to create a stronger company built on a commitment to quality and sustainability. Ideal candidates would be located in an Iowa Based College / University.

Zero Waste Internship

Part time (20 hrs/week) over 2 months

Project-based internship beginning October 1, 2022

Description

Frontier Co-op is seeking an intern to identify and vet solutions to help our co-op reach our Zero Waste goal (90% diversion of waste from landfill) for each of our four Iowa facilities. A successful candidate will provide a final recommendation of fully vetted projects to our management group in December 2022. This intern will meet bi-weekly with our Corporate Social Responsibility Manager to provide project updates, and ensure alignment with our goal. On a daily basis, they will work closely with our Maintenance and Sanitation Manager to:
• gain a thorough understanding of current waste streams, vendors, and processes at each of our facilities,
• identify a series of creative solutions to achieve a 90% diversion rate,
• quantify the diversion impact of each potential solution,
• research the capital or incremental operating cost of each of the identified solutions, and
• provide a ‘menu’ of improvement options and a final recommendation.

Expectations
• In-person visits to our four Iowa facilities once at the beginning of the project (assume 2 working days total)
• Basic understanding of waste materials management
• Strong understanding of systems and process design
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Strong quantitative data management skills

Students working towards a Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Engineering, Sustainability, Environmental Studies or other related program preferred. Students enrolled in a Masters programs is also preferred, but not required. Candidates must have good analytical skills and have the ability to manipulate data in Excel.

For questions, please contact becky.holub@frontiercoop.com

title: Spring 2023 Brands and Properties Internship (Hybrid & Remote)
description:
Wasserman is a full service, culture-centric agency, built to advance the best talent, brands, and properties in the world. We are united by our passion and belief in the power of culture to solve challenges and create new opportunities for our clients. Wasserman creates new connections between brands, properties and consumers every day through our extensive knowledge and relationships across... sports, music, entertainment, fashion, and lifestyle. From straightforward sponsorship evaluation and strategic thought leadership to complex deal negotiation and detailed ROI measurement, we push ourselves and our clients to break the norm, try new things, and leap into the unknown – with confidence.

Internship Overview

Our internship opportunities within our Brands and Properties Division is organized into four areas – Brands, Properties, Experience and Events, and Global Insights. The Brands and Properties teams work on a combination of long-term retainer clients as well as shorter-term project-based work. Our Experience and Events team supports our Brands and Properties clients by developing and executing award-winning activation programs including high-end hospitality events. Our Global Insights team supports all three groups to inform our strategy and activation recommendations. Collectively, our service offerings span Strategy, Execution, Amplification (digital/social), and Measurement solutions tailored to our clients’ specific business and brand objectives.

What Makes Our Internship Unique

Real work! Our program is designed to introduce aspiring sports and entertainment professionals to the industry and our company by integrating them into client facing projects that our full-time staff works on every day.

Day-to-day Duties Include:

• Conduct research and assist with evaluations of new marketing opportunities, sponsorship strategy and portfolio management, brand integration, creative development, measurement and ROI analysis
• Support the department as necessary with special projects or tasks that are both short and long term

Requirements

• Demonstrate excellent organizational, time management and communication (written and oral) skills
• Express a passion for the sports and entertainment industry

Key Spring 2023 Dates

The spring internship program starts on January 23 and ends on April 28

title: Software Developer Intern
description:
Software Developer - Intern

Future Impact and Growth Team...

About the Internship:
The strategy internship provides support to NWEA’s Future Impact and Growth Team to help design and build innovative prototypes that span educational assessment, teaching, and learning including development on various platforms and using various digital tools and programming languages. These prototypes include internal and external partnerships with a variety of organizations, including leading game companies, and developers including rapid prototyping, iterative development, and working with various stakeholders to meet project goals. The internship offers the opportunity to work with award winning teams (both internal and external to NWEA) and mentorship from senior developers and software engineers.

The is a rolling internship program with a timeline determined by the academic institution (if applicable), NWEA, and the intern. NWEA will compensate $1334 (20 hours a week of work) per month or $2667 (40 hours of work a week), paid on a monthly schedule for the duration of the internship (options for internship length include 6 or 12 months and can be part or full time). Compensation is subject to tax. Interns have full access to NWEA facilities and computer hardware and software. NWEA has transitioned to a mostly remote organization, as such interns will be an integrated member of our fully remote team.

Internship details

Start date: October 1 (Flexible)

Duration: Rolling, up to 1-year

Location: Remote

Pay: $1,334/month (20 hours a week) or $2,667/month (40 hours a week)

NWEA offers
• Inclusive, welcoming work environment
• Mentorship during weekly 1:1
• Build colleague connections and working relationships
• Meaningful work, learning opportunities, and collaboration with designers and engineers

What you will gain:
• Hands-on experience with team, project collaboration and development tools
• Experience guiding a project through early ideation phases through development of prototypes
• Opportunities to collaborate closely with design strategists, design researchers, academic researchers, designers, product owners and development peers to ensure products meet the needs of the user
• Opportunities to contribute to presentations of work to stakeholders
• One-on-one conversations with experienced professionals across the organization
• Completed examples showing how development informed prototype creation in an innovative educationally focused development space.

Appropriate skills or experience:
• Undergraduate degree (Associate or Bachelor) enrollment in computer science, software engineering, or a related program
• Experience doing full stack development work
• Experience with various front-end skills and programming languages including JavaScript, HTML/CSS and back-end skills and programming languages including Java, Python, C#
• Experience with developing prototypes for iOS apps (Swift) and Unity (C#).
• Familiarly with core AWS services
• Excellent written and oral communication including strong presentation skills and ability to communicate to diverse audiences and stakeholders
• Self-motivated and results oriented
• Familiarity with team and project collaboration tools (e.g., Slack, Miro, Figma, Teams)
• Ability to work with a diverse team and problem solve to reach shared outcomes
• Experience developing prototypes (coding, programming) on web-based, iOS, and unity platforms.
• Debugging and testing code
• Documenting and testing software
• Researching and fixing a range of technical issues

Preferred skills or experience:
• Rapid prototyping experience including iterative design cycles with data and input from various stakeholders
• Experience developing iOS apps
• Experience collecting telemetry data
• Experience with SQL
• Data management, exporting, cleaning
• Experience using analytical tools (e.g. Heap, hot jar)

Important Note on position skills and abilities:

Expertise in each requirement listed above is not expected — instead, we encourage applications from those who demonstrate a mix of expertise in some areas, and a commitment to learning and experimentation in others. Skills and relevant experience outlined in your application may be paid or unpaid, and can include internships, volunteer work, and practicums. We understand that experience, education and learning, and creativity may take many forms, and expect that qualified applicants may bring additional skills to this position that we’ve not considered or listed here. If this role interests you, we encourage you to apply!

Eligibility:
• Students (half- or full-time) who have completed at least one year of undergraduate work leading toward a baccalaureate degree (preference for those interested in public policy, education, social science, or related fields).
• Students must be enrolled part- or full-time in a degree program at a fully accredited university to be considered for the program. Associate’s and bachelor’s degree seeking students are eligible.

Application Process:

Submit your application via the jobvite link: https://app.jobvite.com/j?cj=o6qTkfwt&s=NWEA_Careers_Site to Dr. Gregory King at greg.king@nwea.org. We would like to receive all applications by September 23, 2022. Applications should include the following:
• Resume or curriculum vitae
• Cover letter that briefly describes:
• Why you are interested in the position and how your experiences would contribute to the position
• Your skills and expertise and how you have used those tools in previous experiences
• Why you are interested in the NWEA Strategy Internship Program and what role you see this experience playing in your career development

About Us

The NWEA™ Strategy Internship Program introduces outstanding undergraduate and graduate students to the organization. Founded by educators over 40 years ago, NWEA is a global not-for-profit educational services organization. More 15 million students and 9,500 partners in U.S. schools, school districts, education agencies, and international schools trust us to offer pre-kindergarten through grade 12 assessments that accurately measure student growth and learning needs, professional development that fosters educators’ ability to accelerate student learning, and research that supports assessment validity and data interpretation. To better inform instruction and maximize every learner’s academic growth, educators currently use NWEA assessments with nearly eight million students.

NWEA strives to make diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility (DEIA) practices the center of our work. Our organization’s mission, Partnering to Help All Kids Learn, is the foundation for our DEIA commitment as we work to reflect, value, and support the educators, students, colleagues, and communities we serve. We seek to empower and engage all stakeholders in the research, services, solutions, and products we provide, our organizational culture, and the partnerships we establish with schools, districts, states, and countries.

title: Summer 2022 Sales Internship (Nationwide)
via: via RJ Reynolds Tobacco Jobs - R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company
description:
Summer 2022 Sales Internship (Nationwide)

Reynolds American is evolving at pace - truly like no other organization...

To achieve the ambition, we have set for ourselves, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to live our ethos every day. Come be a part of this journey!

WE ARE LOOKING FOR TRADE MARKETING INTERNS

SENIORITY LEVEL: Intern

FUNCTION: Marketing – Trade Marketing & Distribution - Field

LOCATION: Opportunities Available Nationwide

ROLE POSITIONING AND OBJECTIVES

Territory Manager (TM) Interns are charged to learn and embody Reynolds Marketing Services Company’s (“RMSC”) strategic vision of redefining the tobacco industry. RMSC’s Territory Manager Interns, with the guidance of mentors, are responsible for representing the company in the sale, marketing and promotion of its full portfolio of products and programs while engaging both retail outlets and adult nicotine consumers.

The TM Intern position allows individuals to work alongside full-time RMSC employees as they consistently demonstrate their entrepreneurial approach in the selling and execution of our brand marketing plans to utilizing the 5P marketing mix; Product Availability, Promotions, Presence, Pricing, and Personal Selling.

Each Territory Manager Intern is provided exceptional training. This includes comprehensive industry learning and coaching support that enables individuals to demonstrate their strengths. The company demonstrates this commitment by empowering employees to challenge conventional thinking and creates an environment for innovative problem solvers.

Independent judgment/decision-making, influencing/sales skills, strong organization, time management and data-analysis skills are key essentials to the position of a full-time Territory Manager. During the Internship Program, Interns will be exposed to training surrounding these skills to best prepare for a career at RMSC.

WHAT YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR
• Participates in a full-time, 40-hour work week Internship Program for 10 weeks.
• Collaborates with other Division and Region teams.
• Develops superior product knowledge and, under mentor guidance, effectively educates and engages adult nicotine customers in dialogue about our portfolio of nicotine products.
• Learns about product sales, distribution, and consumer marketing brand strategies.
• In collaboration with current employees, calls on established traditional and non-traditional retail outlets (c-gas, tobacco shops, convenience stores) while building relationships with store managers/owners.
• Actively promotes the marketing mix driving performance against assigned quantitative and qualitative sales goals and brand measures.
• Develop and present a strategic business analysis project addressing real business opportunities and creating action plans against those opportunities.

CAN THIS BE YOUR FUTURE ROLE?
• Are you looking for an opportunity to implement your ideas and perspectives in order to drive industry transformation?
• Are you a goal-oriented individual who thrives in collaborative team settings?

ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
• Pursuing an undergraduate degree in business, marketing, sales or other related field
• Established ability to work independently and with a team
• Demonstrated ability to build collaborative working relationships
• Transformational Demeanor: effectively exhibits change agility, translates vision into impactful plans, challenges the status quo, manages ambiguity, simplifies, and prioritizes tasks
• Inspiring Leadership: drives alignment, sets clear expectations to elevate individual and team performance, and identify, lead and support initiatives that challenge prevailing attitudes and current processes
• Ability to communicate with and engage retail customers and adult nicotine consumers in person
• Innovative problem solver with strong communication skills

BENEFICIAL
• Previous experience in a marketing focused role - preferably in sales, field market trade or business-to-business
• Geographically mobile

COMPENSATION
• Competitive Annual Salary
• Targeted Annual Bonus
• Relocation assistance available for those who qualify.

BENEFIT SUMMARY

Our company offers very competitive benefit plans, including:
• 401(k) plan that offers opportunity to save on pre- and post-tax basis up to 50 percent of eligible compensation. Company matches 100 percent of employee pre-tax/Roth (401k) contributions up to six percent
• Comprehensive health- and welfare-benefits package
• Eleven paid company holidays annually, plus a generous paid vacation plan based on length of service
• Company-paid sick and personal days, funeral leave and jury duty leave; Also Parental leave/Reduced Work Schedule
• Confidential personal financial counseling service
• On-site health clinics and fitness centers
• A matching grants program that enables employees to direct and double their donations to qualifying charitable organizations of their choice
• Health-care advocacy service
• Volunteer service opportunities
• Federal credit union membership through Allegacy Federal Credit Union
• Extensive training opportunities

Our organization offers a level of challenge, responsibility and creativity for motivated employees that welcome opportunities for growth. We are also committed to employing a diverse workforce and valuing different perspectives, experiences and talents to improve the company's potential for optimally achieving its business objectives!

Reynolds American Inc. and its affiliated companies is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. Only applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process should contact us directly via email at TalentAcquisition@RJRT.com .

About our organization:

Reynolds American Inc. is an indirect, wholly owned subsidiary of British American Tobacco p.l.c., and the U.S. parent company of R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Santa Fe Natural Tobacco Company, Inc.; American Snuff Company, LLC; Modoral Brands Inc.; R. J. Reynolds Vapor Company; Lorillard Licensing Company, LLC; Reynolds Brands, Inc.; Vuse Stores LLC; Kentucky BioProcessing, Inc.; RAI Services Company and Reynolds Marketing Services Company. This position is with Reynolds Marketing Services Company Job Number: 39841

title: 2023 Capital Markets Summer Intern – Early Careers (Undergraduate)
via: via Partners In Diversity Career Center
description:
What you’ll do

Our 10-week paid internship will provide you with the foundation to become a financial market specialist, while working in a dynamic and supportive team environment. You will receive accelerated learning and skill development through a mix of on-the-job training, mentorship, a community of peers and advisors, and a pathway to our full-time Capital Markets Development Program upon... graduation.

Capital Markets Roles:
• Credit Fixed Income (CFI) - originates and trades investment grade and high yield bonds, helping U.S. Bank's customers raise funds and capital in the debt capital markets.
• Municipals Product Group (MPG) - originates and trades tax-exempt and taxable bonds, variable rate demand notes and commercial paper, and direct purchases in addition to offering derivatives solutions for municipal clients.
• Foreign Exchange (FX) - actively participates in global markets with trading capabilities in major, minor, and emerging currencies. FX services are provided to a broad and varied corporate, institutional, and high net worth individual clientele.
• Derivatives Product Group (DPG) - provides privately negotiated contracts that allow clients to manage, reduce or eliminate risks arising from fluctuating interest rates. Typical transactions involve synthetically fixing, capping, or collaring floating interest rates on bank loans, converting fixed rate bonds to floating rate liabilities, and cross currency basis swaps.
• Loan Capital Markets (LCM) - offers product capabilities including Agency Services, Back-stop Programs, Private Placements, Secondary Market Loan Trading Activity, and Syndicated Loans
• Asset Backed Finance (ABF) - provides asset-based loans to Commercial and Corporate clients on a nationwide basis.
• Sponsored Finance - provides corporate finance solutions to private equity owned companies.

As a Capital Markets Intern, you will:
• Get hands-on experience working on projects that impact the business such as:
• Analyzing/preparing financial reports and models (e.g., cash flow models and capital structure analyses)
• Executing due diligence on new client opportunities
• Analyzing market trends and identifying strong investment opportunities
• Preparing presentations and marketing pitch books for prospective investors
• Developing financial terms and conditions (such as pricing)
• Supporting the execution of planned transactions
• Creating and maintaining transaction documentation, as well as transaction reviews
• Develop technical and business acumen through training, mentorship, and exposure to senior executives
• Build a supportive community of peers through a variety of cohort strengthening activities such as social events, development workshops, and catered insight to support your transition from college to the workforce
• Give back to the communities where we live and work

Who we’re looking for

We’re looking for intellectually curious and creative thinkers who can think on their feet and thoughtfully react to a changing market.

Basic qualifications:
• Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree with a target graduation date of December 2023 or May 2024
• Solid understanding of financial markets
• Ability to start internship program on June 5, 2023

Preferred qualifications:
• Preferred GPA of 3.0 or above
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• Solid foundation of economics and finance theory
• Well-versed in current economic conditions and outlook including monetary policy, growth/inflation, and the current interest rate environment
• Knowledge of fixed income mathematics and pricing of derivative applications, including swaps, swaptions, caps, floors, and treasury locks a plus
• Strong in Excel and PowerPoint
• Ability to work well under pressure and time constraints
• Self-motivated with a keen desire to learn and contribute within a dynamic team environment
• Intellectual curiosity
• Attention to detail
• Well-developed analytical skills

title: Program Manager Internship (Part Time, Remote)
description:
School16, a tech skills development education company, is looking for a program management intern to join our team in our mission to prepare professionals for the new economy by teaching them how to rapidly develop soft and hard skills that can translate into jobs that are currently in high demand.

Our programs have been developed and tested at top Universities as well as venture accelerators... and funds, including NYU’s Entrepreneurial Institute, Venture for America, Starta Ventures, State University of New York, and more.

Our network of instructors and speakers include tech leaders at public and private companies like IBM, Google, Facebook, and Slack and all programs are designed and run by practitioners to help students achieve tangible career results.

You’ll be working directly with the company founders and our Lead Instructor throughout this internship.

Responsibilities
• Help handle general program operations, including student onboarding, communication, engagement data tracking, etc.
• Create and manage all student facing platforms and documents before, during, and after the program completion
• Provide in-classroom support to our Lead Instructor during our core 8 week program (Mondays and Tuesdays, 6:00 PM EST - 8:00 PM EST)
• Analyze student data to provide feedback and suggestions on how to improve our programs and processes
• Take initiative on a variety of special projects that allow you to develop new operational skills
• For the right candidate, there is an opportunity for this internship to transition to a full-time role.

Additionally, we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to explore their entrepreneurial ideas, and we will support you on any personal projects through mentorship and advisory as appropriate throughout this internship.

Application Steps

Please submit your resume and an introduction message (similar to a cover letter) that helps us understand why you're the best person for the job. Candidates with a general cover letter that does not address this question will not be considered.
• Please note that this is a Part-Time hourly position that will start at 5-10 hours per week.

About School16

School16 is an education program that helps students and professionals understand the types of jobs in tech that are the best fit for them, what's currently in high demand, how each role functions, and what skills should be developed to land a fulfilling job in this sector. Each week features different instructors that provide unique insight into their background and area of expertise.

School16 focuses on Education, Startups, Recruiting, and Technology. Their company has offices in New York City. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at http://school16.co/ or find them on LinkedIn

title: Engineering Internship

description:
About Us

Chess.com is one of the largest gaming sites in the world and the clear #1 platform for playing, learning, and enjoying chess. We are a team of 335+ fully remote people in 45+ countries working hard to serve the global chess community. We are also growing fast, with more than 80 million players having chosen Chess.com as their online chess home, and a large base of happy premium... subscribers. We are a tech company. A gaming company. A content company. And we do it all with passion and commitment to the game. Above all, we prize our mission-driven, flat, life-celebrating, no-corporate culture, and we look forward to meeting you and learning more about what you can bring to the team.

About You

Above all, you love chess and want to share it with the world! You also naturally resonate with a variable mix of the following qualities, and are eager to learn how all of these qualities can be foundational to your career:
• Multidisciplinary: ability to switch between relevant subject matter with relative ease.

• Ability to simplify: absorb inherent complexity within your projects, and cut through the complexity to offer more simplified solutions.
• Agile: able to maximize output/productivity + future-proof for further growth.
• Holistic understanding: see how the various parts work within the whole of a project, and how the overall project combines the distinct parts to achieve the high level goals; also see how the project fits within the greater whole of the company.

• You are DEDICATED to having a spirit of excellence
• You want to build a career - not just make fast bucks

4. The internship lasts for 6 months for most growth - think of it as an immersive training and experiential learning program. There are opportunities later if you perform well.

NOTE: The stipend is modest, however, this is a great opportunity to build feedback and experience on the Upwork platform.

We operate in the Singapore timezone (GMT +8) during the daytime since that's when our team is most active. To avoid exhaustion on your end, we’d appreciate it if you weren’t involved in any full-time work. This is not suitable for full-time students as well.

To show me you actually read this application thoroughly and have good attention to detail please tell me what is the color of the ocean first in your cover letter and also clearly state why you'd be right to commit to an internship. You'd be surprised how many people don't read fully, and this shows us that they wouldn't be great on this job which requires attention to detail.

Please read everything once more to be sure that you understand all the tasks and everything else that is stated and required above. Don’t forget to attach the screenshots for your internet speed test and typing test in your application

title: Software Developer Intern
description:
We believe the permission-less and composable benefits of Web3 will drive the next generation of financial products. Companies building in "DeFi" are already making available to retail users products that are not available in a traditional finance environment due to market inefficiencies and layering. Working with us you will be exposed to the cutting edge of fintech product development and adoption.

In-office or remote depending on candidate location.

Objectives
• Collaborate with product designer to develop the best experience for our retail and institutional users
• Implement frontend designs using React, NextJS, CSS-in-JS and other JS frameworks
• Work in an Agile environment, leveraging GitHub, Asana, Discord and following industry best practices

Requirements
• Currently enrolled in or... recent graduates of bachelor's degree in computer science or similar discipline

• Self-motivated and love working in a fast paced, collaborative and iterative start-up environment

Benefits

• Have flexibility and opportunity in working on projects that inspires you the most

title: Quality Control Internship
description:
About Uniplaces

Uniplaces is building a trusted, global brand for students. We believe in empowering student mobility and we have started by making the process of finding accommodation easier. We're solving real-life pains and we're backed by top-tier investors such as Atomico, Octopus Investments, Shilling Capital Partners, and Caixa Capital to help us achieve this better and faster.

We are an internationally-minded company with an extremely talented team and global ambitions. Our decisions are driven by our core values of Passion, Impact, Trust, and Team Spirit - with which we aim at having a company where everyone feels accountable and empowered to achieve their full potential.

About the Operations Team

Every day, more than 5000 nights are booked by students from 175 nationalities in 33 different cities on . Our Operations team which embraces 14 nationalities and works across 6 different languages, ensures that every interaction with customers is focused on improving the... student and landlord experience, so that room search becomes as easy as buying a flight ticket.

What would your mission be:
• To ensure maximum quality content of new supply
Main Responsibilities:
• Scan, analyse and prioritize the contents provided by Landlords or Internal Teams in the context of their listing(s)' creation or update.
• Detect lack and incoherences in the information provided
• Order and process contents according to the company's business priorities.
• Create listings on the company's back office to be published on our website
• Develop written content for new listings
• Revise live listings to ensure the highest quality of supply
• Engage Landlords with the platform by welcoming & explaining basic procedures
• Proactively suggest, structure and monitor improvements on creation Topics

What is the profile we are looking for?
• Detail oriented
• Results driven
• Team worker
• Creative
• Ability to work under pressure
• Proficient in English (spoken & written)

What else do you need to know?
• Work from anywhere. If you are in Portugal you can work from the office once a week;
• An internship contract with a duration of 6 months
• An internship grant + meal allowance will be provided
• An amazing experience within an international environment
• Required availability of 40 hours a week

Does it sound like the job for you?
Great
Please apply below and let us know why you believe you're the perfect fit for the role :)

title: Student intern, Account Representative (Position can be anywhere...
company_name: Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation - CMHC
description:
At CMHC, we trust you to get the job done. Since January 2019, we’ve shifted from managing people to managing work. Each employee is 100% autonomous and accountable. You can choose where you need to be and when you need to be there to meet your objectives. You’re in control of your time and are trusted to make the right decisions.

Student intern, Account Representative (Position can be anywhere in Canada)

Help make a difference for Canadians. CMHC’s aspiration is that by 2030, everyone in Canada has a home that they can afford and that meets their needs. All of our programs and activities support this singular goal.

Be part of an inclusive workplace. Diversity and Inclusion guides everything we do at CMHC. We’re takingâ€¯concrete actions to eliminate racism and embed equity into our culture, processes, programs, and policies so that they reflect the lived experiences of all Canadians.

Join the Client Operations Team, where we make housing affordability solutions easy. You will... assume the responsibility for a portfolio of accounts, including the administration and decisions relevant to contracting, advancing, servicing and lending activities for the purpose of mitigating risks, optimizing client service and achieving corporate objectives. You will provide superior quality service that contributes to a positive corporate image and sound business relationships with a broad range of industry clients through internal and external liaisons.

We are currently hiring for 2 full-time Student Interns for a 4-month Summer term (May - August).

Responsibilities:

• Offers advice, support and alternative solutions to CMHC's clients through the communication of key decisions, the interpretation of policies and the provision of responses to inquiries.

• Ensures timely and accurate servicing of accounts for own portfolio, including but not exclusive to progress advances, contracting, repayments, taxes and legal executions.

• Ensures that all documentation is in place in accordance with program audit requirements, and maintains a high standard of accuracy and data quality.

• Assumes responsibility for working in a team environment in contribution to service standards and turnaround times.

• Uses effective communication techniques, both written and oral, to deliver quality service and takes immediate action to address client needs and inquiries.

Minimum Qualifications

• Pursuing a college or an undergraduate degree in a relevant field such as business administration, accounting or legal.

• Knowledge of mortgage financing and real estate laws, default remedy and/or property administration would be an asset.

• Analytical and problem-solving skills.

• Strong oral and written communication skills.

• Bilingualism (French and English) is an asset.

title: Finance: Fall Co-op Internship Opportunities
description:
At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passion, and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology. The internship is designed not only for you to do great work with the opportunity to learn and grow, but to experience our culture full of diverse community connection, executive engagement, and memorable events.

Imagine yourself as a Microsoft intern. Join Microsoft today and help us innovate and shape the business of tomorrow.

We’re a company of learn-it-alls rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.

Are you ready to join us and create the future? Come as you... are, do what you love—start your journey with us today! 

Responsibilities
• Please note that these co-op internships are 8 months in length***

Role Descriptions

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available Finance intern roles, including but not limited to, those described below:

Finance Analyst Intern

Overview

As a Financial Analyst Intern, you’ll learn how to perform financial analysis from full-time professionals at Microsoft. This unique opportunity will get you involved in the dynamic high-tech space solving problems using best-in-class financial tools. You’ll also be able to explore one of many areas of Microsoft Finance: Financial Planning and Analysis, Treasury, Capital Markets, Sales and Marketing, Finance, Accounting, or any one of the many product groups such as Office, Xbox or many others.

Interns will interact directly with Finance Rotation Program Analysts, who serve as dedicated coaches for Finance interns. Coaches ensure you have the resources and encouragement needed to succeed in your internship and they take care to explain your future career opportunities if you return full-time. You will have the opportunity to participate in social events held by the Microsoft internship and Finance Rotation programs, where you can socialize with interns from across the company as well as those who are in similar internships.

Responsibilities

You will become a valued and integral member within your finance area. You will work on a variety of projects that directly impact the business, such as building models, forecasting, market research, or creating internal tools or databases. Your manager will work with you to make sure your projects are meaningful and relevant based on your interests and development needs. Additionally, you will receive finance-specific training and have access to all company-wide training resources to help you succeed in your role.

Qualifications

Qualifications
• Available for an 8 month consecutive internship starting August 2022
• Pursing a bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, economics, or business with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship
• One year of classroom or work experience in financial risk analysis preferred.
• Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.

Visit our Careers FAQ Page to learn more about the interview process and answers to commonly asked questions.  

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work

title: Software Engineering Intern (Back End - Summer 2023)
description:
Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as the 'perfect' candidate. HubSpot is a place where everyone can grow. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day.

HubSpot is looking for co-ops who are interested in solving complex problems and being part of one of the fastest growing, most ambitious engineering teams in the world. HubSpot engineering co-ops work with our engineers in small teams with minimal process and are given the freedom to do big things and own the software they create. Must be available to work full time from June - August 2023 to apply.

Our technology stack is diverse, and we are looking to fill roles for a variety of projects including:
• Middle tier APIs & web services in Java (DropWizard)
• Dynamic web applications written in JavaScript (React, ECMAScript 6, Sass)
• Core data... and infrastructure development with HBase, Elastic Search, ZooKeeper, Redis, MySQL, and Memcached.
• Running, monitoring, and deploying to thousands of servers in multiple data centers & the cloud (DevOps & SRE)

Candidates should have web development experience (projects like mobile apps, web apps, or games beyond coursework is a plus) and top candidates will have:
• An unmatched curiosity to learn and grow their skills with new challenges
• A strong understanding of HubSpot’s business, products, and culture
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills
• Confidence taking on big initiatives and leading projects in a fast-paced environment

As an engineer you will get a MacBook Pro 16 and a GitHub Enterprise account on your first day. Working closely with your team, you will start shipping production code right away.

Come help us build real products that thousands of customers depend on. To read more about our Product and Engineering team at HubSpot, check out this page : http://product.hubspot.com/jobs-internships-co-ops

For more information on HubSpot's internship and co-op opportunities, visit HubSpot.com/Students

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.

Important COVID-19 Guidance (For candidates applying to roles in the United States):

Per HubSpot’s policy all employees who wish to work @office or @flex or to visit an office in-person must be fully-vaccinated. At this time, @remote employees are not required to be vaccinated.

Germany Applicants: (m/f/d) - link to HubSpot's Career Diversity page here.

About HubSpot

HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in theHubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn aboutour commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #2 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2022, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.

Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit ourcareers websiteto learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.

By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information

title: Winter 2023 Intern, Deep Learning for Computer Vision
description:
Winter 2023 Intern, Deep Learning for Computer Vision
Mountain View, CA / Engineering Internships / Intern Kodiak was founded in April 2018 to develop autonomous technology that carries freight forwardso people, partners, and the planet thrive. Navigating highway environments present vastly different challenges than urban streets. Kodiaks experienced team has developed the industrys most advanced technology stack purpose-built specifically for long-haul trucks. From our sensor fusion system that maximizes the value of every sensing modality to our unique lightweight mapping solution that allows our trucks to navigate ever-changing highway construction zones, our world-class team of industry pioneers is bringing the benefits of autonomy to the $800B a year trucking industry quickly, safely, and efficiently.
We are looking for a highly skilled Computer Vision intern to join us and solve real-world robotics problems. In this role, you will:
+ Be responsible for designing machine learning... algorithms and implementing them in robust, efficient, and well-tested C++ and/or Python code.
+ Lead the development of deep neural networks to solve real-world robotics challenges such as lane detection, object detection and classification, sensor fusion, tracking, prediction, anomaly detection, and planning.
+ Work with the camera, laser, radar, and ultrasound data and curate datasets for machine learning.
+ Set up automated training pipelines and develop data analytics tools to incrementally improve our performance on a growing dataset.
Qualifications:
+ Strong technical background. You are currently pursuing an MS or Ph.D. and have hands-on experience in designing and implementing deep neural networks; exceptional candidates pursuing a BS are considered. You are a skilled software engineer with experience in C++ and strong problem-solving skills. You are passionate about solving real-world robotics problems, and you have ideally worked on autonomous robots before. You ideally also have a strong knowledge of data processing pipelines for training ML models in the cloud.
+ A team player. You take ownership and work with the team to deliver exceptional results. You are interested in the performance of the entire system across engineering disciplines.
+ Ability to build and iterate quickly. You enjoy working fast and smart, and you are comfortable in the earlier stages of developing an algorithm from scratch.
+ Hands-on. You are not only passionate about ML research but also experienced working with production machine learning pipelines, from dataset collection and labeling to training and validation.
+ Great communicator. You have experience writing clear, concise, and detailed documentation. You can enable your colleagues to leverage the ML models resulting from your work in their algorithms and systems.
+ Start Date: January 2023.
+ Our internship program is 12-16 weeks; the end date is flexible based on individual needs.
+ Location: Mountain View, CA
+ Housing: interns are responsible for housing.
What We Offer:
+ A fast paced environment where we work with talented, committed and supportive teammates.
+ Competitive pay.
+ Excellent medical, dental and vision benefits.
+ A beautiful facility in Mountain View.
+ We love our dogs, so we are a dog friendly officeFree catered lunch

title: Civil Engineering Intern
description:
Job Summary

AECOM is seeking a Civil Engineering Intern to be based in Edmonton, Alberta

This position is expected to begin in January 2023

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity... entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
• Project Management, assisting leadership with various management activities of multi-disciplinary teams consisting of consultants, contractors, clients and stakeholders, Work with the project team to control scope, schedule, quality and budget of OE team, Assessing whether project activities are in accordance with the best practices of project management methodology, processes and procedures, Assisting coordination of external consultants and contractors to meet project objectives in a collaborative manner, Documenting project activities
• Design Review, reviewing project documentation prepared by other parties for contract compliance, Attending and documenting technical meetings, Coordination of and support for design review teams
• Schedule Review, Evaluation of overall project status, analysing field reports to assess contractor performance, Tracking progress of construction activities
• Construction Review, performing field inspections of construction activities, Coordination of and support for construction monitoring teams, assisting with resolution of technical challenges related to construction, evaluate whether construction activities are compliant with contract

Minimum Requirements
• Currently pursuing a degree/diploma in Civil Engineering, must have completed two years of study
• Must currently be in a relevant co-op program

Preferred Qualifications
• None

Additional Information:
• This will be an 8 month term
• Sponsorship is not available for this position
• Relocation per diem is not available for this position
• AECOM is seeking a student looking for an exciting and challenging co-op work term placement (4 or 8 months) on a large, complex LRT construction project located in Edmonton, Alberta. The role is primarily to support the Owner's Engineer project management team. The Owner's Engineer is a diverse, multi-firm, multi-disciplinary group of local and international engineering professionals lead by AECOM

What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
